titlepage.p: © 2015 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Guide to the Hoover Institution Archives Motion Picture Films
did.abstract: This guide describes motion picture films from various collections in the archives. The guide is organized by collection title and includes the number of films, the film gauge(s), and the content matter of the films within each collection. When applicable, the guide lists access copies and external links to online content. Non-film materials may be described in the links provided to the respective guides for each collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Each collection of films described in this list has its own collection title. Please use the following citation format, replacing "Collection Title" with the name of the collection used.
[Identification of item], Collection Title, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to each collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Searchworks at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Searchworks is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The motion picture films in the Hoover Institution Archives collections consist of home movies, documentaries, publicity films, newsreels, television shows, speeches, and many other films that are not commercially available, and are exclusive to the Hoover Institution Archives. The films document historical events such as the dropping of the atomic bomb on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, the Russian Revolution, World War II, and many other events.

This guide describes motion picture films from various collections in the archives. The guide is organized by collection title and includes the number of films, the film gauge(s), and the content matter of the films within each collection. When applicable, the guide lists access copies and external links to online content. Non-film materials may be described in the links provided to the respective guides for each collection.
In order to view materials in the archives, please note the reference copy number(s).

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: 1914-1936 [Tysioc dziewiecset czternascie tysioc dziewiecset trzydziesci szesc],

scopecontent.p:
The films in the collection relate to Polish history from 1914 to 1936. (2 35mm films)
Use copies of motion picture films in this collection are available for immediate access. Use copy reference number: 2003c83_v_0003762

The films in this collection relate to the activities of the 40th Bomb Group in the China-Burma-India and Pacific Theaters during World War II. (2 16mm films)
To view films during your visit, please contact the Archives before your arrival. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

Motion picture film is the original footage that depicts the explosion of atom bombs over Hiroshima and Nagasaki, Japan. (5 16mm films)

did.unittitle: Brown (Edmund G)Edmund G. Brown Press conference recording 1964,

scopecontent.p:

Use copies of motion picture films in this collection are available for immediate access: https://archive.org/details/csth_00008

did.unittitle: Pacific Gas and Electric Company Program Series,

scopecontent.p:

"The German west boundary." Use copy reference number: 80023_f_0001039. "A battery goes into position." Use copy reference number: 80023_f_0001033.
"Decision on the Balkan peninsula I: advance from all sides." Use copy reference number: 80023_f_0001040.
"Invasion of France; Hitler accepts French surrender." 80023_f_0001036.
"Aircraft at the Berlin airport." 80023_f_0000987.
"Austria returns home 13 March 1938/the Fuhrer in Italy 3-9 May 1938." 80023_f_0001016.
"The trip home: the Europa on the high seas." 80023_f_0001017.
"Soldiers build a pontoon bridge." 80023_f_0001041.
"The crossing of the Rhine River and conquest of the Maginot Line / Breaching the Maginot Line; Advancing in France; at sea; Hitler at memorial in Munich, 1940 November 23." 80023_f_0002141.
"German mountain troops in the Caucasus; FW-200 bombers attack ships in the Atlantic." 80023_f_0001018."
